label: Undated Letter 2 from Gertrude Sanford Legendre
description: Letter from Gertrude Legendre to her husband, Sidney Legendre, regarding a small gift she has sent for he and Morris with an officer being transferred to Hawaii and relaying song lyrics from a Judy Garland song she heard on the radio. Additional pages of the letter are missing.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Gertrude Legendre to her husband, Sidney Legendre, regarding a small gift she has sent for he and Morris with an officer being transferred to Hawaii and relaying song lyrics from a Judy Garland song she heard on the radio. Additional pages of the letter are missing.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Later - 9P.M.
2
I am in bed. I have just had a delicious massage [and] supper on a
tray in bed - It is very pleasant as I am tired from a hot, long
dreary day-
I wrapped up two little flat lucky pieces for you [and] Morris
while I had Rose take to the P.O. to-night so that Lt. Willing
Pepper from Philla - can bring them to you in person -
[and] in this way I can make sure that you will both
get some little token of my love before Xmas
comes [and] goes and the Xmas mails disappoint you.
I am sorry not to have had the chance
to meet Lt. Pepper as I would have been able
to tell him all sorts of messages [and] he could have
told you he had seen me - however - I am
lucky to get this off with him as he is leaving
for the coast the 22nd or 23rd
Have you heard that song Judy Garland sings
on the Radio - called "Oceans Apart"? She sang
it to-night -
"Oceans apart
And with only the blue between
Since we're apart
I'm yearning to kiss him again
Right from the very start
We were never mean [scratched out]
to be oceans apart."
That is all too true.
I must go to sleep my darling and kiss you goodnight.
I give you a big hug. My heart is so full of longings
as I lie here listening to music on the radio - I feel it will
bust.
Goodnight my sweet.
Gertie -
